details.title: EC rejects demands for checking VVPATs first and not in the end
details.content: The Election Commission on Wednesday had rejected the Opposition’s demand to count five random VVPATs first, and not at the end, as is the current practice. so that if there is a problem or mismatch, all VVPAT slips can be counted before it is late Opposition parties subsequently criticised the poll panel sharply, calling it a “black day for democracy”. However, BJP National President Amit Shah said the opposition to the machines disrespects the mandate of the people.

details.title: Highest voter turnout
details.content: The 2019 Lok Sabha elections, which spanned over six weeks, have registered the highest ever voter turnout in the history of Indian parliamentary elections. The final voter turnout stands at 67.11 per cent, the Election Commission announced Wednesday. 66.40 per cent voter turnout was recorded in the 2014 general election, and in the 2009 election, it stood at 58.19 per cent.

details.title: Voting held in 542 of 543 seats
details.content: Voting was held for 542 of 543 Lok Sabha seats; polling in Vellore in Tamil Nadu had been cancelled after the seizure of large stores of cash. A fresh date for the Vellore seat has yet to be announced.

details.title: Explained: Counting process and why results will be delayed this year
details.content:
1. The counting of votes will be done by the Returning Officer (RO), who is an officer or a local authority nominated by the Commission for each constituency.
  2. Postal ballots will be the first to be counted. Service voters stand at 18 lakh. The exercise of counting postal ballots manually will itself take a couple of hours at least. 
  3. Counting of votes in the EVMs start after 30 minutes, even while counting of postal ballots is going on.
  4. VVPAT tallying will be taken up after all rounds of EVM counting are over. On an average, it takes an hour to verify slips of one VVPAT machine. This time, the EC anticipates a delay of almost five hours in final result announcement (due to an increase in the number of VVPAT verification to five random EVMs. In April, the Supreme Court had ordered the EC to increase VVPAT slips from one EVM per Assembly constituency to five).
  5. The exercise of tallying voter verified paper audit trail slips with the EVMs will take place in five polling stations per assembly segment which effectively means that out of nearly 10.3 lakh polling stations, the EVM-VVPAT matching will take place in 20600 such stations.
  6. In case of a mismatch between the VVPAT and the EVM count, the VVPAT count will prevail.

details.title: What are VVPATs?
details.content:
Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) is a method of providing feedback to voters using a ballotless voting system. VVPAT is a verification system for voting machines designed to allow voters to verify that their vote was cast correctly and to provide a means to audit the stored electronic results. It contains the names of the candidates for whom votes have been cast.

details.title: Congress set to fall below 100 seats if early trends hold
details.content: It was expected. But now it is turning into a reality. Going by early trends, the Congress is set to fall well short of 100 seats. Rahul Gandhi himself is facing a stiff fight in Amethi if these trends are anything to go by. Will Smriti Irani, who lost to him by over a lakh votes in 2014, upset him in his pocket borough? It could well be one of the big stories of this elections if that comes to pass.

details.title: UDF is leading at 19 seats in fourth hour of counting
details.content:
• LDF is leading in Kasaragod constituency only. NDA is yet to register a lead in any of the seats.
  • The head to head battle between UDF and LDF had come from two constituencies - Kasaragod and Alappuzha. While KP Sathishchandran had a lead of 3396 votes against Rajmohan Unnithan of UDF in Kasaragod, Shanimol Usman had a wafer thin lead of 288 votes against LDF candidate AM Ariff at Alappuzha.
  • At Thiruvananthapuram, which is witnessing a tough fight between UDF and BJP, Shashi Tharoor is leading by 12,753 votes while BJP's Kummanam Rajasekharan is second.
  • Rahul Gandhi in Wayanad has a clear cut lead of 1,12,064 votes.
  • The second highest lead is from Malappuram constituency where UDF's PK Kunjalikutty had a lead of 86,270 votes. At Alathur, UDF's Ramya Haridas had a lead of 44,399 votes against sitting MP PK Biju.

details.title: UDF all set to sweep Kerala
details.content:
• As the counting of votes enters into the ninth hour, UDF in Kerala has registered a clear-cut majority in 19 seats.
  • For the LDF, the ruling front in the state, the sole consolation has come from the Alappuzha constituency where AM Ariff leads by 13,016 votes against UDF's Shanimol Usman when 90.32 per cent of the votes get counted.
  • At the capital city, where the exit polls predicted that the BJP will open an account, Shashi Tharoor who is seeking a third term has so far registered an overwhelming majority of 61,067 votes with 83.15 per cent votes being counted.
  • Kummanam Rajasekharan with 2.71 lakh votes has so far emerged as the only BJP candidate in the state to come in the second slot.
  • At the same time, Rahul Gandhi with a lead of 3,63,202 votes in Wayanad, has become the first candidate who registered a brutal majority.
  • Of the 20 constituencies, it is only at Idukki that counting has been finished.

details.content: Just like Lord Krishna said he was on the side of Hastinapur in the battle of Mahabharata, 130 crore Indians have said today, they are on the side of India.: PM Modi

Aaj desh ke koti-koti nagrikon ne iss fakir ki jholi ko bhar diya hai. Main Bharat ke 130 crore nagrikon ka sar jhuka kar ke naman karta hoon: PM Modi (Today, people from all parts of the country have filled the bag of this mendicant. I bow my head in respect and gratitude to the 130 crore citizens.)
Nobody can now wear a veil of secularism to mislead the country: PM Modi

PM: I was busy today. So I couldn't pay attention to results. I don't have much information about it. But I was briefed by party president.I'll see it in detail. But from what he told me, that itself indicates that political pundits will have to change their 20th century thinking pic.twitter.com/5zTJXwd2HH

— ANI (@ANI) May 23, 2019

details.title: Only two castes today, says PM Modi
details.content: In India there are two castes; one is poverty and the other are the people who want to contribute in any way to eradicate poverty: PM Modi

details.title: Na ruke, na jhuke, na thake: PM Modi
details.content:
Never stopped, never bowed down, never got tired when it came to staying with our (BJ[P's) ideology: PM Modi

भाजपा की एक विशेषता है कि हम कभी दो भी हो गए, लेकिन हम कभी अपने मार्ग से विचलित नहीं हुए।

आदर्शों को ओझल नहीं होने दिया।

न रुके, न झुके, न थके।

कभी हम दो हो गए, तो भी और आज दोबारा आ गए।

दो से दोबारा होने की यात्रा में कई उतार चढ़ाव आए: पीएम मोदी #VijayiBharat pic.twitter.com/8kRkLEvk9p

— BJP (@BJP4India) May 23, 2019
I might make mistakes, but won't ever act maliciously. In the coming days, I won't do anything with ill intention, said Prime Minister as he concluded his speech.

details.title: Gajendra Singh Shekhawat retains Jodhpur seat
details.content: Congress leader Ashok Gehlot’s son Vaibhav Gehlot loses to Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Shekhawat won the seat with a high margin of 2,74,440 votes.

details.title: Ravi Shankar Prasad beats Shatrughan Sinha by around 1.5 lakh votes
details.content:
In Bihar's Patna Sahib, Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad beat Shatrughan Sinha, actor and BJP rebel who joined the Congress ahead of the elections.

Shatrughan Sinha accepts defeat (Photo | PTI)

details.title: Former Indian PM HD Deve Gowda loses Tumkur seat
details.content: In Tumkur Lok Sabha seat in Karnataka, BJP candidate GS Basavaraju has defeated JD(S) heavyweight and former prime minister HD Deve Gowda.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu's son loses
details.content: TDP's Nara Lokesh loses from Telangana's Mangalagiri assembly seat to YSRCP MLA Alla Rama Krishna Reddy by 5300 votes.

details.title: Dhaai kilo ka haath' Sunny Deol wrests Gurdaspur
details.content:
Actor-turned-neta Sunny Deol has won from Gurdaspur, Punjab beating rival and senior Congress leader Sunil Jakhar. Sunny's father Dharmendra tweeted congratulations to his son.

Faqeer Badshah Modi JI , Dharti puttra sunny Deol, Congratulations. Achhe Din Yaqeenan Ayen pic.twitter.com/wisnZ6XIpa

— Dharmendra Deol (@aapkadharam) May 23, 2019
Uttar Pradesh Lok Jan Shakti Party candidate, Chirag Kumar Paswan has won from Jamui (SC), Bihar

details.title: Harsimrat retains Bathinda
details.content: Former Punjab CM Sukhbir Singh Badal's wife and two-time parliamentarian Harsimrat Kaur Badal beat Congress's Amrinder Singh Raja Warring.

details.title: Maharashtra: BJP winning in 23 seats and Sena in 18

BJP's Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur and Congress' Digvijay Singh at old Central Jail where counting of votes is in progress for Bhopal seat.

details.title: Mayawati: Prime ministerial 'aspirations' on hold
details.content: The BJP has trumped Mayawati's Bahujan Samaj Party's alliance with Akhilesh Yadav's Samajwadi Party in Uttar Pradesh. Yet her own party has done better than in 2014 Lok Sabha polls when it drew a complete blank. READ FULL STORY HERE

details.content: Known as an astute strategist whose non-political interests range from playing chess and watching cricket to stage performances and listening to classical music, 54-year-old Amit Shah is often hailed as the BJP's most successful president for crafting its way to power states after states. details.title: Varun Gandhi wins in Pilibhit
details.content: Varun Gandhi wins from Pilibhit, UP, defeating Hemraj Verma of the SP by a margin of over 2.50 lakh votes.

Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala distributing ladoos to winning candidates Adoor Prakash and Shashi Tharoor. KPCC president Mullappally Ramachandran and AICC general secretary Oomen Chandy look on. (Photo | Vincent Pulickal, EPS)

details.title: Madhya Pradesh CM's son wins from Chhindwara
details.content: Nakul Kamal Nath wins from Chhindwara with a margin of over 38,000 votes. He will succeed his father who has represented Chhindwara ten times in the lower house.

details.title: Slain Arunachal Pradesh MLA wins from his constituency
details.content:
• Slain Arunachal Pradesh MLA and National People’s Party candidate Tirong Aboh has won from his Khonsa West seat in Tirap district. He defeated the BJP’s Phawang Lowang by 1,055 votes.
  • Aboh, his son and nine others, including security personnel, were gunned down by suspected militants on 221 May when they were travelling from Assam’s Dibrugarh to Khonsa.
YSR Congress President YS Jagan Mohan Reddy with his mother Vijayalaxmi and wife Bharti after their party's victory in assembly and Lok Sabha elections in Amravati on 23 May 2019. (Photo | PTI)
TMC candidate from Jadavpur seat Mimi Chakraborty flashes the victory sign after winning in the Lok Sabha elections. (Photo | PTI)

details.title: Milind Deora loses in Mumbai South constituency
details.content: The son of late Congress leader Murli Deora lost to Shiv Sena’s Arvind Sawant. Industrialists Mukesh Ambani and Uday Kotak had endorsed Deora.

details.title: Gourav Gogoi of INC wins in East Assam's Kaliabor
details.content: Former Assam CM Tarun Gogoi's son beat AGP's Moni Madhab Mahanta.

details.title: Rahul wins Wayanad with record margin
details.content: Congress President Rahul Gandhi wins Kerala's Wayanad seat - the second seat he contested in the 2019 polls - with a record margin of 431,770 votes, as per EC data.
BJP's Dayanidhi Maran wins from Chennai Central against Sam Paul of PMK.

details.title: Bengal's BJP chief Dilip Ghosh wins Medinipur LS seat
details.content: BJP's West Bengal President Dilip Ghosh won the Medinipur Lok Sabha seat defeating Trinamool Congress' Manas Bhunia on Thursday.

details.title: MNF wins Mizoram's lone LS seat
details.content: C. Lalrosanga of the ruling Mizo National Front (MNF) was declared elected from the state's lone Lok Sabha seat, defeating his nearest Independent rival Lalnghinglova Hmar by 8,307 votes.
